newsitem.title: UK: NatWest tries to halt bid talk-paper.
newsitem.headline: NatWest tries to halt bid talk-paper.

text.p: National Westminster Bank has asked the Takeover Panel to force its rival Barclays Plc to make an "unequivocal statement" about whether it intends to launch a bid, the Financial Times said on Monday.

NatWest was concerned by takeover rumours have caused anxiety among its staff, the paper said, and quoted NatWest as saying, "Takeover Panel rules are meant to protect people from these sorts of things."

It said a merger between the two would be unlikely to be approved on competition grounds since both banks have a large share of the small and medium sized business banking markets. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
